Description: Verify if the counterparty has valid business registration and operating licenses within their scope of business
Check if the signatory has proper authorization with valid power of attorney or authorization documents
Assess if the counterparty has sufficient financial resources and technical and personnel capabilities to perform
Examine if rights and obligations are balanced between parties without obviously unfair terms
Verify that our core rights are clearly defined and effectively protected
Check if our obligation scope is clearly defined avoiding ambiguous language
Check for clauses allowing counterparty to unilaterally modify the contract
Verify price is clearly stated with payment method timing and conditions specified
Check for price adjustment clauses and whether adjustment conditions are reasonable
Verify responsibility for various costs (taxes shipping etc) is clearly assigned
Check if contract term is clearly specified with clear start and end dates
Check if renewal conditions are clear and whether automatic renewal risks exist
Verify termination conditions are clear and we have reasonable exit mechanisms
Check if conditions procedures and consequences for early termination are specified
Verify breach liabilities are clear proportionate and penalties are reasonable
Check if damage compensation scope is defined including indirect losses
Check for liability caps and whether limits are reasonable
Review exclusion clauses for reasonableness and protection of our interests
Check if dispute resolution method favors us and venue selection is appropriate
Verify governing law is specified and favorable to our position
Check if confidential information scope is clearly defined including necessary trade secrets
Check if confidentiality period is reasonable and aligns with contract term
Verify intellectual property ownership is clearly defined and our rights protected
Check if IP usage scope method and duration are clearly specified
Verify IP infringement liability is clearly addressed
Check if force majeure clause is comprehensive with reasonable scope
Verify notice methods and addresses are clearly specified
Check if conditions and procedures for contract amendment are specified
